title: Rs 2 Lakh 'Jesus Shoes' Injected With Holy Water & Blessed By Priest Sell Out In Minutes
text:
Rs 2 Lakh 'Jesus Shoes' Injected With Holy Water & Blessed By Priest Sell Out In Minutes

Rs 2 Lakh 'Jesus Shoes' Injected With Holy Water & Blessed By Priest Sell Out In Minutes

A one-of-a-kind limited edition, holy water-filled sneakers blessed by a priest reportedly sold out in just minutes! And guess the price of the shoes? The iconic shoes were sold at a whopping price of Rs 2.13 lakh ($3000)!

The pair of white Nike Air Max 97s termed ‘Jesus Shoes’ were manufactured by a Brooklyn-based creative label MSCHF and what makes these shoes special is that they are injected with holy water from the Jordan River, Fox News reported. The water can be seen floating in the sole of the shoes.

Walk on water while blessing your kick game with the exclusive all white Nike Air Max 97 MSCHF x INRI Jesus Shoes.

Shop the sneakers on StockX: https://t.co/ulGquMQIPm pic.twitter.com/npejhQ3Lrs — StockX Sneakers (@StockXSneakers) October 8, 2019

The shoes reportedly also have a Bible verse Matthew 14:25 - the passage describing Jesus walking on water - on the sides along with a single blood drop that symbolises the blood of Christ.

Other things include the frankincense-scented insoles, a crucifix threaded through the laces and a red sole - which depicts the red shoes traditionally worn by past Popes. When the shoe is so religious, the packing also has to be religious! The shoe box displays an angel and a seal resembling the official papal seal.

"We thought of that Arizona Iced Tea and Adidas collab, where they were selling shoes that [advertised] a beverage company that sells iced tea at bodegas," Fox News quoted the head of commerce Daniel Greenberg as telling the New York Post.

"So we wanted to make a statement about how absurd collab culture has gotten," he added.

Fashion has a very different meaning now, don’t you agree?
